role.MIF65Label: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION (Net) Investment in capital assets (Account No 391)
role.documentation: The net investment in capital assets component of net position consists of capital assets, net of accumulated depreciation, reduced by the outstanding balances of bonds, mortgages, notes, or other borrowings that are attributable to the acquisition.
role.label: Net Investment in Capital Assets

role.MIF65Label: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net OPEB Asset (Account No 191)
role.documentation: The net OPEB Asset is computed as the difference between the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments attributed to past periods of employee service and the OPEB plan’s fiduciary net position.
role.label: Net OPEB Asset

role.MIF65Label: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net OPEB Asset (Account No 191)
role.documentation: The net OPEB Asset is computed as the difference between the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments attributed to past periods of employee service and the OPEB plan’s fiduciary net position. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Net OPEB Asset, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, OPEB Obligation (Account No 335)
role.documentation: The net OPEB liability is measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that is attributed to past periods of employee service, net of the OPEB plan's fiduciary net position.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability
role.periodEndLabel: Net OPEB Liability at End of Period
role.periodStartLabel: Net OPEB Liability at Beginning of Period

role.documentation: Information about Net OPEB liability.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability [Roll Forward]

role.documentation: Net OPEB Liability as a percentage of covered payroll.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability as Percent Covered Payroll

role.documentation: Net OPEB Liability, principal due within one year. An employer's net OPEB obligation is defined as the cumulative difference between annual OPEB cost and the employer's contributions to a plan, including the OPEB liability or asset at transition, if any. Use this concept when there is an OPEB liability.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability, Principal Due Within One Year

role.MIF65Label: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net Pension Asset (Account No 190)
role.documentation: The excess of net position in a pension system to the total pension liability. It should be measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected payments that is attributable to past periods of employee service, net of the pension plan’s fiduciary net position.
role.label: Net Pension Asset

role.MIF65Label: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net Pension Asset (Account No 190)
role.documentation: Amount of the excess of net position in a pension plan system to the total pension liability. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Net Pension Asset, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about net pension liability.
role.label: Net Pension Liability [Roll Forward]

role.MIF65Label: LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, Net Pension Liability (Account No 334)

role.periodEndLabel: Net Pension Liability at End of Period
role.periodStartLabel: Net Pension Liability (Asset) at Beginning of Period

role.MIF65Label: LONG TERM LIABILITIES, Net Pension Liability (Account No 334)
role.documentation: Represents the shortfall of net position in a pension system to the total pension liability and should be measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected payments that is attributable to past periods of employee service, net of the pension plan’s fiduciary net position, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Net Pension Liability, Modified Accrual
role.periodEndLabel: Net Pension Liability at End of Period
role.periodStartLabel: Net Pension Liability at Beginning of Period

role.documentation: Net position represents the difference between all other elements in a statement of net position and should be displayed in three components namely net investment in capital assets, restricted (distinguishing between major categories of restrictions), and unrestricted. Use PeriodEnd or PeriodStart labels to represent end of period or start of period balance.

role.documentation: Information about notes and loans payable.
role.label: Notes and Loans Payable [Abstract]

role.documentation: Amount of the portion of tax anticipation notes or other notes or loans to be paid by the local unit. A note payable is an unconditional written promise signed by the maker (authorized local unit officials) to pay a certain sum of money on demand or at a fixed or determinable time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Debit for payments made on such notes; credit for the number of notes to be paid during the current year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Notes and Loans Payable, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: The amount due to the local government unit on loans and notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received. This amount is net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
role.label: Notes and Loans Receivable, Net, Noncurrent

role.documentation: The amount due to the local government unit on loans and notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received.
role.label: Notes and Loans Receivable, Noncurrent

role.documentation: Information about notes and loans receivable.

role.label: OPEB Annual Required Contribution

role.documentation: Amortization method for funding the system's unfunded actuarial accrued liabilities is level percent, level dollar, or other. Level percentage payments are should grow each year. Level dollar amortization is similar to a mortgage, the same payment is made every year. The amortization period is the timespan the actuary uses to pay down the unfunded liability.

role.documentation: A target or recommended contribution to a defined benefit pension plan for the reporting period, determined in conformity with Actuarial Standards of Practice based on the most recent measurement available when the contribution for the reporting period was adopted. Alternate definition: a calculated contribution into a defined benefit pension plan for the reporting period most often determined based on the funding policy of the plan. Typically the Actuarially Determined Contribution has a normal cost payment and an amortization payment.
role.label: Actuarially Determined Pension Contribution

role.MIF65Label: PENSION AND HEALTH BENEFIT PLANS, Pension, Pension Expense.
role.documentation: Employer’s required contributions to the pension plan for the reporting period and separate liabilities to the pension plan that arise in the reporting period. This is the difference in net pension liability from the previous measurement date to the current measurement date. Pension expense includes the current period service cost, interest on the total pension liability, changes in benefit terms that are required to be recognized immediately, projected earnings on the pension plan investments and the current period’s recognition of deferred outflows and inflows.
role.label: Pension Expense

role.documentation: The date of experience studies on which the significant assumptions used in the actuarial valuation are based.

role.documentation: The funded percentage of a plan is the percentage of the dollar value of the accrued benefits that is covered by the actuarial value of assets.

role.documentation: Amortization method for funding the system's unfunded actuarial accrued liabilities is level percent, level dollar, or other. Level percentage payments are should grow each year. Level dollar amortization is similar to a mortgage, the same payment is made every year. The amortization period is the timespan the actuary uses to pay down the unfunded liability.
role.label: Pension Plan Amortization Method

role.documentation: Program revenues from capital grants and contributions. Program revenues are amounts derived directly from the program itself or from parties outside the reporting government's taxpayers or citizenry, as a whole. Program revenues reduce the net cost of the function to be financed from the government's general revenues.

role.documentation: Program revenues from charges for services. role.documentation: Revenue from Rents. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Rents, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue from royalties.
role.label: Revenues from Royalties

role.documentation: Revenues earned from sale of fuel.
role.label: Revenues from Sale of Fuel

role.documentation: Revenue earned from sales and use tax levied which is defined as a tax on the storage, use, or consumption of a taxable item or service on which no sales tax has been paid. Use tax is a complementary or compensating tax to the sales tax and does not apply if the sales tax was charged.
role.label: Revenues from Sales and Use Tax

role.documentation: Revenue from sales and use tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Sales and Use Tax, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from sales tax which is imposed  by the government on the sale of goods and services. A conventional sales tax is levied at the point of sale, collected by the retailer, and passed on to the government.
role.label: Revenues from Sales Tax

role.documentation: Revenue from sales tax which is imposed upon the sale or consumption of goods. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Sales Tax, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from shared revenue which is a government unit’s apportioning of part of its tax income to other units of government. For example, provinces or states may share revenue with local governments, or national governments may share revenue with provinces or states.
role.label: Revenues from Shared Revenue

role.documentation: Revenue from shared revenue. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Shared Revenue, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: SPECIAL ASSESSMENTS, Special Assessments (Account No 450-474)
role.documentation: Compulsory levy made against certain properties to defray all or part of the cost of a specific capital improvement or service deemed to benefit primarily those properties. A special assessment tax is a surtax levied on property owners to pay for specific local infrastructure projects such as the construction or maintenance of roads or sewer lines.
role.label: Revenues from Special Assessments

role.MIF65Label: OTHER REVENUE, Special assessments (Account No 450-474)
role.documentation: Revenue from special assessments. Compulsory contributions and reimbursements from owners of property benefited by improvements, for example, streets, sewers, sidewalks, or water extensions, as well as for servicing special assessment debt. Excludes: proceeds from sales of special assessment bonds and maintenance assessments. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Special Assessments, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from interest on loans generated through the Bankhead–Jones Farm Tenant Act of 1937 (P.L. 75-210) which was passed on July 22, 1937 and authorized acquisition by the federal government of damaged lands to rehabilitate and use for various purposes. The law authorized a credit program to assist tenant farmers to purchase land.
role.label: Revenues from Sub Marginal Land Act

role.documentation: Revenue from a subsidy which is a direct or indirect payment, usually in the form of a cash payment from the government or a targeted tax cut.
role.label: Revenues from Subsidies

role.MIF65Label: TAX REVENUE, Tax reverted property (Account No 424)
role.documentation: Revenue from tax reverted property.
role.label: Revenues from Tax Reverted Property

role.MIF65Label: TAX REVENUE, Tax reverted property (Account No 424)
role.documentation: Revenue from tax reverted property. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Tax Reverted Property, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: All revenue generated from taxes which are mandatory contributions levied on individuals or corporations by a government entity—whether local, regional, or national. Tax revenues finance government activities, including public works and services such as roads and schools, or programs.
role.label: Revenues from Taxes

role.MIF65Label: TOTAL TAX REVENUE
role.documentation: All revenue generated from taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Taxes, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: TAX REVENUE, Trailer taxes (Act 243 of 1959) (Account 434)
role.documentation: Revenue from trailer tax.
role.label: Revenues from Trailer Tax

role.MIF65Label: TAX REVENUE, Trailer Taxes (Act 243 of 1959) (Account 434)
role.documentation: Revenue from trailer tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Trailer Tax, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from transaction privilege tax levy.
role.label: Revenues from Transaction Privilege Tax

role.documentation: Revenue earned from transfer stamps tax levied which is a transaction fee imposed on the transfer of title to property. Transfer taxes are not considered deductible real estate taxes.
role.label: Revenues from Transfer Stamps Tax

role.documentation: Revenue from transfer stamps tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Transfer Stamps Tax, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Tuition and fees assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
role.label: Revenues from Tuition and Fees

role.documentation: Tuition and fees (less refunds, remissions, and exemptions) assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
role.label: Revenues from Tuition and Fees (Net of Allowances)

role.documentation: Revenue earned from unclaimed property which can be lost or forgotten assets from dormant bank accounts, uncashed checks, valuables left in safe deposit boxes and stock certificates.
role.label: Revenues from Unclaimed Property

role.documentation: Revenue earned from usage of utilities tax which is levied in proportion to gross receipts on public or privately owned public utilities that provide electric, gas, water and/or telephone service.
role.label: Revenues from Usage of Utilities Tax

role.documentation: Revenue from use of money and property.
role.label: Revenues from Use of Money and Property

role.documentation: Revenue from use of money and property. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Use of Money and Property, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from vehicles tax levied which is a vehicle license cost recovery fee based on the estimated average per day per vehicle portion of total annual vehicle licensing, titling, and registration costs or as otherwise defined under applicable law.
role.label: Revenues from Vehicles Tax

role.documentation: Revenue from vehicles tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Vehicles Tax, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Governments should establish a policy that defines operating revenues and expenses that is appropriate to the nature of the activity being reported, disclose it in the summary of significant accounting policies, and use it consistently from period to period. A consideration for defining a proprietary fund's operating revenues and expenses is how individual transactions would be categorized for purposes of preparing a statement of cash flows using Section 2450.
role.label: Operating Revenue

role.documentation: State-local revenue sharing can be defined as money given to localities-primarily counties, townships, cities, and villages-to be spent on purposes determined by the localities themselves.
role.label: Revenue Sharing

role.documentation: Program revenues used for airport services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Records all airport expenditures within this single activity. When used by a local unit, it will reflect all expenditures of an airport operation including administration, facilities, and equipment operation and maintenance, etc.
role.label: Revenue for Airport Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for ambulance, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Ambulance

role.documentation: Program revenues used for building authority, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Building Authority

role.documentation: Program revenues used for cemetery, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Cemetery

role.documentation: Program revenues used for community development, which are incremental revenues derived from the specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Community development is the practice of taking on activities that provide basic services to communities. It supports the development of strong communities to improve quality of life.
role.label: Revenue for Community Development

role.documentation: Program revenues used for community services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Community Services ensures that people have at least basic services. There are a large number of services provided which have a direct and immediate effect on the quality of the lives of the people in that community.
role.label: Revenue for Community Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for conservation services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Conservation Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for contingency services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Contingency Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for convention center services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Convention Center Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for economic development services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Economic Development services connect businesses with resources and programs for current and prospective business owners.
role.label: Revenue for Economic Development Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for education, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Education Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for elections, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Elections

role.documentation: Program revenues used for electricity and power services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The public utility providing facilities for the jurisdictional transmission and distribution of electricity to retail customers, except building or facility owners/operators that manage the internal distribution system serving such building or facility and that supply electric power and other related electric power services to occupants of the building or facility.
role.label: Revenue for Electricity and Power Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for equipment and equipment rental, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Equipment and Equipment Rental

role.documentation: Program revenues used for garage services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Garage Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for general governments services administration, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for General Government Administration

role.documentation: Program revenues used for general governments services, judicial, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Judicial

role.documentation: Program revenues used for general governments services legislative and executive, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Legislative and Executive

role.documentation: Program revenues associated with general governments services, other, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for General Government Services, Other

role.documentation: Program revenues used for golf, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Golf

role.documentation: Program revenues used for harbor services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Harbor Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for higher education, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Higher Education

role.MIF65Label:
STATE GRANTS, Streets and Highways (Non-Act 51) (Account No 546)
CONTRIBUTIONS FROM LOCAL UNITS, Highways and Streets (Account No 581-599)
role.documentation: Program revenues used for highways and streets, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Highways and Streets

role.documentation: Program revenues used for homestead, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Homestead

role.documentation: Program revenues used for jail stores commissary services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Jail Stores Commissary Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for library services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Library

role.documentation: Program revenues used for medical care facilities, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Medical Care Facility

role.documentation: Program revenues used for other development services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Other Development Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for other services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Other Programs

role.documentation: Program revenues used for other public services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The technical definition of public service is a service provided by the government to the people in a specific jurisdiction. Services may be provided by the government itself, or paid to a private organization to provide them. For instance, a fire or police department is a government-run agency, but trash pickup provided by an independent contractor is a public service financed by the jurisdiction.
role.label: Revenue for Other Public Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for planning and zoning, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Cities, villages and townships designate neighborhood areas for the purpose of planning and carrying out local public improvements for the prevention of blight within such areas; to authorize assistance in carrying out plans for local improvements by the acquisition and disposal of real property in such areas; to provide for the combining of neighborhood improvements that benefit the entire neighborhood into improvement projects; to provide for the establishment of local assessment districts coterminous with the neighborhood boundaries; and to prescribe the methods of financing the exercise of these powers.
role.label: Revenue for Planning and Zoning

role.documentation: Program revenues used for property maintenance, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Property Maintenance

role.documentation: Program revenues used for Public Assistance Services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Public assistance refers to assistance programs that provide either cash assistance or in-kind benefits to individuals and families from any governmental entity. There are two major types of public assistance programs; social welfare programs and social insurance programs.
role.label: Revenue for Public Assistance Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for Public Health and Sanitation Services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Sanitation Services include services provided under contract to other governmental agencies, sale of sewage by-products, service charge for use of mains and trunk lines, refuse disposal fees, sale of garbage, sewer connection charges, septic tank inspection and laboratory fees. Public Health Sanitation Division is responsible for developing, administering, and implementing a state wide program designed and dedicated to the eradication, control, and constant improvement of environmental and public health factors that may, through direct or indirect causes, adversely affect the health and well-being of people.
role.label: Revenue for Public Health and Sanitation Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for Public Schools Services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The government interacts with its own schools (known as public schools) at the federal, state, and local level. Each level of government provides a different amount of funding to schools and requires varying degrees of accountability within the schools and school districts.
role.label: Revenue for Public Schools Services

role.MIF65Label: CONTRIBUTIONS FROM LOCAL UNITS, Gas, Water and Electric Utilities (Account Nos 581-599)
role.documentation: Program revenues used for Public Utilities, including gas, water and electric, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Public Utilities

role.documentation: Program revenues used for Public Ways and Facilities, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Facilities is responsible for maintaining county owned roads, bridges, buildings, vehicles, and equipment; managing landfill, recycling, and litter control operations; and providing snow removal or emergency response services for severe weather-related road conditions. Facilities also provides educational and outreach opportunities for residents to learn about services and programs.
role.label: Revenue for Public Ways and Facilities Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for Public Works Services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The Department of Public Works-Facilities (Facilities) provides crucial services that improve the quality of life for the residents and ensures infrastructure and assets are safe and reliable.
role.label: Revenue for Public Works Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for sanitary sewer services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Sanitary Sewer Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for security of persons and property services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Security of Persons and Property services are provided by the City's Police Department which works to provide professional law enforcement services to keep citizens and property safe. Special emphasis is placed on community-oriented programs that will prevent crime and forge a partnership between officers and citizens.
role.label: Revenue for Security of Persons and Property Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for state health benefit, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for State Health Benefit

role.documentation: Program revenues used for storm sewer services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Storm Sewer Services

role.documentation: Program revenues used for telecommunication, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Telecommunications

role.documentation: Program revenues used for township properties, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Township Properties

role.documentation: Program revenues used for unemployment compensation, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Unemployment Compensation

role.documentation: Program revenues used for water supply services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
role.label: Revenue for Water Supply Services

role.documentation: Revenue generated from auxiliary services provided.
role.label: Revenues from Auxiliary Enterprises

role.documentation: Information about revenues.
role.label: Revenues [Abstract]

role.MIF65Label: OTHER REVENUE, Emergency services (ambulance) (Account No 676-686)
role.documentation: Revenues earned from emergency services and ambulance used in the General Fund or Special Revenue Ambulance Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Ambulance and Emergency Services, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue for cultural activities.
role.label: Revenues for Cultural Activities

role.documentation: Information about revenues for public works.
role.label: Revenues for Public Works [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about revenues from community and economic development.
role.label: Revenues from Community and Economic Development [Abstract]

role.MIF65Label: dup_1_TOTAL COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT
role.documentation: Revenues from community and economic development services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Community And Economic Development Services, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: dup_3_COMMUNITY/ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, Register of Deeds (Account No 711)
role.documentation: Revenues earned from the Abstract Department, used on the General Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Abstract Department, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Nonoperating revenues from connection fees.
role.label: Revenues from Connection Fees, Nonoperating

role.documentation: Revenue earned from current real property tax levied.
role.label: Revenues from Current Real Property Tax

role.documentation: Revenues generated by the Department of Public Works (DPW), which is on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, office supplies, travel, maintenance, and equipment of an administrative nature. Within other funds, it reflects all costs chargeable to a specific DPW project, or which costs may or may not be recoverable from another unit or government. It may also be used to reflect revenues generated by the DPW. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Department of Public Works, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues from interest and dividends, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Dividends, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about revenues from financial and tax administration.
role.label: Revenues from Financial and Tax Administration [Abstract]

role.documentation: Revenues earned from the clerk's office from other General Fund revenue. units of government. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Clerk, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned after the property tax foreclosure process within the delinquent tax revolving fund. The act states the foreclosing governmental unit must deposit the proceeds from the sale of tax delinquent property into a "restricted account" created for each year a property sale is held. The restricted accounts should be established within the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund based on the year of the sale. This activity (Activity # 254--Delinquent Tax Property Sales) is used to record the sale proceeds and the authorized expenditures of the proceeds. When the forfeited property is sold, the proceeds from the sale should be recorded in the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund under revenue account "Charge for Services-Sales." Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Delinquent Tax Property Sales, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from the operation of the Information Technology Department. May be used in the General Fund or a corresponding Enterprise Fund or Internal Service Fund. Its use is mandatory in the Internal Service Fund and Enterprise Fund. Its use is optional in the General Fund. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Information Technology, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues from general government, finance and tax administration. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Financial and Tax Administration, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: dup_9_Current Expenditures General Government, Clerk (Account No 215-218)
role.documentation: Revenues earned from services rendered to other units or other departments. Used in the General Fund of a local unit of government. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Property Description, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned by the Treasurer's office from other General Fund revenue. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Treasurer, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about revenues from health and welfare.
role.label: Revenues from Health and Welfare [Abstract]

role.documentation: Revenues earned from health and welfare, child care, Department of Human Services, on the General Fund or Child Care Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Child Care, Department of Human Services, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from health and welfare, child care, family division of circuit court, used n the General Fund or the Child Care Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Child Care, Family Division of Circuit Court, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned by the Health Department used on the General Fund or Health Department Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Health Department, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: TOTAL HEALTH AND WELFARE
role.documentation: Revenues earned for various public health and mental health programs within a local unit, as well as programs providing assistance for economically disadvantaged persons and businesses within the area. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Health and Welfare, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from mosquito control, used on the General Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Mosquito Control, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from interest and penalties on special assessments.
role.label: Revenues from Interest and Penalties on Special Assessments

role.documentation: Revenue earned from interest and penalties on taxes, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Interest and Penalties on Taxes, Modified Accrual

role.MIF65Label: dup_4_INTEREST AND RENTS, Interest & Dividends (Account No 665-666)
role.documentation: Revenues from interest and dividends, reported on a modified accrual basis..
role.label: Revenues from Interest, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about revenue earned from judicial activities.
role.label: Revenues from Judicial [Abstract]

role.documentation: Represents all court related revenues within a local unit of government. Organization units may include trial court, circuit court, district court, and friend of the court. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Judicial, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned for judicial activities related to the circuit court, such as court filing fees, court costs, appeal fees, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Circuit Court, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from the district and municipal court, used in the General Fund of counties, certain cities, and certain townships which are designated by statute as control units of district courts. (A few cities still have municipal courts.) Mandatory for those units that have such a court. Reflects revenue such as filing fees, civil fees, court costs, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from District And Municipal Court, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from friend of the court, used on the General Fund or Friend of the Court Fund or both funds of a county. Its use is mandatory. Reflects revenue such as support fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Judicial, Friend of the Court, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from the law library, used on the General Fund and Law Library Fund of a county. Its use is mandatory. It may be used in the Law Library Fund to record penal fine revenues . (The circuit judge approves purchases). Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Law Library, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from probate court, used on the General Fund of a county. Reflects statutory revenue for estate cases, adoptions, and other probate matters. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Probate Court, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from probation, used on the General Fund of a county or a city. Its use is mandatory for units having a probation officer (Department). Reflects revenues such as oversight fees, court costs, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Probation, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information revenues from other general government.
role.label: Revenues from Other General Government [Abstract]

role.documentation: Revenue from building authority, such as rental or lease income, interest earned, etc. Used on the General Fund of local units of government and/or in the records maintained by a statutory building authority. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Building Authority, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenue earned from other general activities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Other General Government, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Contributions by employees and employers, interest earned on investments and other retirement system and VEBA (Voluntary Employee Beneficiaries Association) revenues. Used on the General Fund and Retirement Fund of local units of government. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Retirement Board, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about revenues from public safety.
role.label: Revenues from Public Safety [Abstract]

role.documentation: Revenues earned from animal shelter and dog warden activities is on the General Fund Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Animal Shelter, Dog Warden, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from public safety services, fire department. Used on the General Fund or Fire Fund of local units of government that have such an activity. Units with a fire department may budget separately for activities such as administration, firefighting, fire prevention, training, and communication. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Public Safety, Fire Department, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from public safety services, used in the General Fund or Police (Sheriff) Fund of local units of government that have such an activity. It includes accounts for recording expenditures incurred by the police/sheriff department in the administration of various law enforcement activities. Units may budget separately for police activities such as administration, crime control and investigation, traffic, and safety programs, training, and communication. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Public Safety Services, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about revenues from public works.
role.label: Revenues from Public Works [Abstract]

role.documentation: Revenues earned from airport services used on the General Fund or Airport Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Airport Services, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Expenditures for various public works of a local unit. These include the public works department, drain expense, roads and streets, street lighting, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Public Works Services, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from the transportation system used on the General Fund or Transportation System Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Transportation Services, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues earned from public works, water and sewer systems. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Water and Sewer Systems, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Information about revenues from recreation and culture.
role.label: Revenues from Recreation and Culture [Abstract]

role.MIF65Label: dup_5_RECREATION AND CULTURE, Library (Account No 790-791)
role.documentation: Revenues earned from library operations, used on the General Fund or a Library Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Revenues from Library, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Revenues from recreation and culture activities, used on the General Fund or Park/Recreation Fund. It reflects revenues earned in park facilities, recreation programs, and cultural programs within a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

role.documentation: That part of a scholarship or fellowship that is used to pay institutional charges such as tuition and fees or room and board charges. Scholarships and fellowships include Outright grants-in-aid, trainee stipends, tuition and fee waivers, and prizes awarded to students by the institution, including Pell grants. Awards to undergraduate students are most commonly referred to as "scholarships" and those to graduate students as "fellowships." These awards do not require the performance of services while a student (such as teaching) or subsequently as a result of the scholarship or fellowship. The term does not include loans to students (subject to repayment), College Work-Study Program (CWS), or awards granted to a parent of a student because of the parent's faculty or staff status. Also not included are awards to students where the selection of the student recipient is not made by the institution.
role.label: Scholarship Allowances

role.MIF65Label: OTHER FINANCING SOURCES, Transfers In (Account No 699)
role.documentation: Transfers which are inflows of assets to a fund. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment.
role.label: Transfer of Capital Assets In

role.MIF65Label: OTHER FINANCING SOURCES, Transfers in (Account No 699)
role.documentation: Transfers which are inflows of assets to a fund. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Transfers In, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Flows of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment.
role.label: Transfers, Net

role.MIF65Label: OTHER FINANCING USES, Transfers (out) (Account 995)
role.documentation: Transfer which are outflows of assets to another fund within the same reporting entity. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment.
role.label: Transfers of Capital Assets Out

role.MIF65Label: OTHER FINANCING USES, Transfers (out) (Account 995)
role.documentation: Transfer which are outflows of assets to a financing source. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses.” Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Transfers Out, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Unclaimed money in the possession of the local unit such as outstanding or unclaimed payroll checks and other checks, unclaimed meter deposits, other unclaimed trust, and agency money, etc. Unclaimed money must be reported to the State Treasurer annually. Unclaimed money is considered to be abandoned: 1) attempts to contact the owner fail. If these attempts are unsuccessful, the money is turned over to the State Treasurer where the owner or the owner's heirs may claim it, 2) The due date for the annual unclaimed property report (holder report) is July 1 for property reaching its dormancy period as of March 31.
role.label: Unclaimed Money

role.documentation: Unclaimed money in the possession of the local unit such as outstanding or unclaimed payroll checks and other checks, unclaimed meter deposits, other unclaimed trust, and agency money, etc. Unclaimed money must be reported to the State Treasurer annually. Unclaimed money is considered to be abandoned: 1) attempts to contact the owner fail. If these attempts are unsuccessful, the money is turned over to the State Treasurer where the owner or the owner's heirs may claim it, 2) The due date for the annual unclaimed property report (holder report) is July 1 for property reaching its dormancy period as of March 31. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
role.label: Unclaimed Money, Modified Accrual

role.documentation: Collections of money for which the proper account is not immediately identifiable. When the proper distribution is determined, amounts must be transferred from this account to the proper account(s).
role.label: Undistributed Receipts

role.documentation: Collections of money for which the proper account is not immediately identifiable. role.documentation: Amounts held for various tax collections before analysis and distribution. Cash disbursements are not to be made from this account. If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Disclaimer of opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Disclaimer

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination is that the financial statements were not prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), but were instead prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework as defined in AU-C 800 "Special Considerations - Audits of Financial Statements Prepared in Accordance with Special Purpose Framework". If so, select "Adverse opinion" as TRUE, and select this concept as TRUE. If not, report this concept as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Not US GAAP

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Qualified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Qualified

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Unmodified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Unmodified

role.documentation: The CFDA number is a two-digit prefix representing the Federal Awarding agency and a three digit extension separated by a period. The last three digits of the CFDA number represent the program which should be listed in the CFDA catalog. If the program is unknown, enter a "U" followed by a two-digit number in the CFDA extension to identify one or more Federal award lines that form the program. For example, the first Federal program with an unknown three-digit extension would be U01 for all award lines associated with that program, the second would be U02, and so on. If the program is part of the Research and Development cluster and the three-digit CFDA extension is unknown, enter "RD" as the three-digit extension.

role.documentation: Enter the applicant's congressional district. Enter in the format: 2 characters state abbreviation - 3 characters district number, e.g., CA-005 for California 5th district, CA-12 for California 12th district, NC-103 for North Carolina's 103rd district. If all congressional districts in a state are affected, enter "all" for the district number, e.g., MD-all for all congressional districts in Maryland. If nationwide, i.e., all districts within all states are affected, enter US-all. If the program/project is outside the US, enter 00-000. This optional data element is intended for use only by programs for which the area(s) affected are likely to be different than place(s) of performance reported on the SF-424 Project/Performance Site Location(s) Form.
role.label: Congressional Districts of Applicant

role.documentation: Enter the congressional district of the program or project. Enter in the format: 2 characters state abbreviation - 3 characters district number, e.g., CA-005 for California 5th district, CA-12 for California 12th district, NC-103 for North Carolina's 103rd district. If all congressional districts in a state are affected, enter "all" for the district number, e.g., MD-all for all congressional districts in Maryland. If nationwide, i.e., all districts within all states are affected, enter US-all. If the program/project is outside the US, enter 00-000. This optional data element is intended for use only by programs for which the area(s) affected are likely to be different than place(s) of performance reported on the SF-424 Project/Performance Site Location(s) Form.
role.label: Congressional Districts of Program or Project

role.documentation: Indicates if the award was received directly from a Federal awarding agency. If funds were received directly, report as TRUE; if funds were received as a pass-through, report as FALSE. When an award consists of both direct and indirect funds, use the element AmountExpendedDirect, and AmountExpendedIndirect to represent the amounts. If an award is received directly, but then transferred to another part of the same single audit reporting entity, these awards should still be reported as direct (transfers within the single audit reporting entity do not create a pass-through entity/subrecipient relationship).

role.documentation: For new applications, do not report Estimated Unobligated Federal Funds. For continuing grant applications, submit the Budget Summary before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency, and report estimated unobligated amounts which will remain unobligated at the end of the grant funding period only if the federal grantor agency instructions provide for this. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, do not report unobligated fund amounts.
role.label: Estimated Unobligated Funds, Federal

role.documentation: For new applications, do not report Estimated Unobligated Non-Federal Funds. For continuing grant applications, submit the Budget Summary before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency, and report estimated unobligated amounts which will remain unobligated at the end of the grant funding period only if the federal grantor agency instructions provide for this. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, do not report unobligated fund amounts.
role.label: Estimated Unobligated Funds, Non Federal

role.documentation: Cumulative amount of Federal fund disbursements (such as cash or checks) as of the reporting period end date. Disbursements are the sum of actual cash disbursements for direct charges for goods and services, the amount of indirect expenses charged to the award, and the amount of cash advances and payments made to subrecipients and contractors. For multiple grants report each grant separately on the FFR attachment. The sum of the cumulative cash disbursements on the FFR attachment must equal the amount reported for this concept.
role.label: Federal Cash, Cash Disbursements

role.documentation: Report the amount of Cash Receipts minus Cash Disbursements. Represents immediate cash needs. If more than three business days of cash are on hand, the Federal agency may require an explanation which can be entered using the Remarks concept explaining why the drawdown was made prematurely or other reasons for the excess cash.
role.label: Federal Cash, Cash On Hand

role.documentation: Unliquidated obligations on a cash basis are obligations incurred, but not yet paid. On an accrual basis, unliquidated obligations are obligations incurred, but for which an expenditure has not yet been recorded. Enter the Federal portion of unliquidated obligations. Those obligations included direct and indirect expenses incurred but not yet paid or charged to the award, including amounts due to subrecipients and contractors. On the final report, this reported value should be zero unless the awarding agency has provided other instructions. Do not include any amount that has been included in Federal Share of Expenditures, or any amount for a future commitment of funds (such as a long-term contract) for which an obligation or expense has not been incurred.
role.label: Federal Expenditures, Federal Share of Unliquidated Obligations

role.documentation: Specify whether a cash or accrual basis was used for recording transactions related to the award(s) and for preparing the FFR. Accrual basis of accounting refers to the accounting method in which expenses are recorded when incurred. For cash basis accounting, expenses are recorded when they are paid.

role.documentation: For new applications, report the total amount of funds needed to support the project for the first funding period (usually a year), which should be the sum of New or Revised Budget, Federal and Non Federal. For continuing grant program applications, the amount reported should be the sum of the New or Revised Budget, Federal and Non Federal. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, report the new total budgeted amount plus or minus the increase/decrease in New or Revised Budget, Federal and Non Federal, as appropriate.
role.label: New or Revised Budget

role.documentation: For new applications, report the amount of Federal funds needed to support the project for the first funding period (usually a year). For continuing grant program applications, submit these forms before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency and report the amount of funds needed for the upcoming period. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, report the amount of the increase or decrease of federal funds.
role.label: New or Revised Budget, Federal

role.documentation: For new applications, report the amount of Non-Federal funds needed to support the project for the first funding period (usually a year). For continuing grant program applications, submit these forms before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency and report the amount of funds needed for the upcoming period. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, report the amount of the increase or decrease of non-federal funds.
role.label: New or Revised Budget, Non Federal

role.documentation: Recipient share of actual cash disbursements or outlays (less any rebates, refunds, or other credits) including payments to subrecipients and contractors. This amount may include the value of allowable third party in-kind contributions and recipient share of program income used to finance the non-Federal share of the project or program. Note: On the final report this should be equal to or greater than the amount of Total Recipient Share Required.
role.label: Recipient Share of Expenditures

role.documentation: Total required recipient share for reporting period specified in this report as Reporting Period End. The required recipient should include all matching and cost sharing provided by recipients and third-party providers to meet the level required by the Federal agency. This amount should not include cost sharing and match amounts in excess of the amount required by the Federal agency (for example, cost overruns for which the recipient incurs additional expenses and, therefore, contributes a greater level of cost sharing or match than the level required by the Federal agency).
role.label: Recipient Share Required

role.documentation: Amount of Recipient Share Required minus Recipient Share of Expenditures. If recipient share is greater than the required match, enter zero.
role.label: Remaining Recipient Share to be Provided

role.documentation: Social Security Administration (96) is the Federal Awarding Agency.
role.label: Social Security Administration (96) [Member]

role.documentation: Special Education Cluster member.
role.label: Special Education Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Indicates the type of Special Purpose Framework which may be Cash basis, Tax basis, Regulatory basis, Contractual basis, or Other basis.
role.label: Special Purpose Framework Type

role.documentation: Information about the financial statements that were prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework.
role.label: Special Purpose Framework [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates if the Special Purpose Framework used as a basis of accounting required by state law. Report as TRUE if required, report as FALSE if it was permitted by state law but not required. This will affect whether the entity can qualify as a low-risk auditee in the two subsequent audit periods (2 CFR 200.520(b)).
role.label: Special Purpose Framework Required by Law

role.documentation: Date the application was made available to the State for review under the Executive Order 12372 Process.
role.label: State 12372 Review Date

role.documentation: Identifier that is assigned by the state, if applicable.
role.label: State Application Identifier

role.documentation: State Cluster member.
role.label: State Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Name of the State Cluster. Used if State Cluster was selected from ClusterNameEnumerated.
role.label: State Cluster Name

role.documentation: State.
role.label: State [Member]

role.documentation: Student Financial Assistance Cluster member.
role.label: Student Financial Assistance Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: An indicator if a summary schedule of prior audit findings is required to be reported. If there is, report as TRUE; if there is not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Summary Schedule Prior Audit Findings Required Reported

role.documentation: Link to supporting documents as specified in agency instructions.
role.label: Supporting Documents Link

role.documentation: TANF Cluster member.
role.label: TANF Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Tennessee Valley Authority (62) is the Federal Awarding Agency.
role.label: Tennessee Valley Authority (62) [Member]

role.documentation: Estimated federal funds that will be required in the third funding year.
role.label: Third Future Funding Period

role.documentation: Third quarter.
role.label: Third Quarter [Member]

role.documentation: Title of an additional note 3 in the notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards.
role.label: Title of Additional Note to the SEFA 3

role.documentation: Title of an additional note 2 in the notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards.
role.label: Title of Additional Note to the SEFA 4

role.documentation: Amount of Federal program income earned. Do not report any program income that is being allocated as part of the recipient's cost share amount included in Recipient Share of Expenditures.
role.label: Total Federal Program Income Earned

role.documentation: Transit Services Programs Cluster member.
role.label: Transit Services Programs Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Trio Cluster member.
role.label: Trio Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Information about the type of Uniform Guidance Audit.
role.label: Type of Audit [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about the type of audit findings.
role.label: Type of Audit Finding [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates the type of opinion for a Single Audit Report for a Major Program. Can be reported as Unmodified opinion (U), Qualified opinion (Q), Adverse opinion (A), or Disclaimer of opinion (D). For clusters of programs, the type of audit report must apply to the cluster as a whole, and should be reported for all programs in a cluster. If the program is not a Major Program, do not use this element.
role.label: Type of Single Audit Opinion

role.documentation: U.S. Agency for International Development (98) is the Federal Awarding Agency.
role.label: U.S. Agency for International Development (98) [Member]

role.documentation: Amount of Total Federal Program Income Earned minus Program Income Expended in Accordance with the Deduction Alternative or the Addition Alternative. This amount equals the program income that has been earned but not expended, as of the reporting period end date.
role.label: Unexpended Program Income

role.documentation: Indicate if the Uniform Guidance Audit is Single Audit or Program-specific Audit. 2 CFR 200.501 of the Uniform Guidance requires non-Federal entities that expend $750,000 or more in a year in Federal awards to have a single audit conducted, except when they elect to have a program-specific audit conducted in accordance with 2 CFR 200.507.
role.label: Uniform Audit Guidance Type

role.documentation: United States Institute of Peace (91) is the Federal Awarding Agency.
role.label: United States Institute of Peace (91) [Member]

role.documentation: Federal Funds Authorized minus total Federal Share.
role.label: Unobligated Balance of Federal Funds

role.documentation: WIOA Cluster member.
role.label: WIOA Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Water and Waste Program Cluster member.
role.label: Water and Waste Program Cluster [Member]

r759.note: Can be used with NameOfCapitalAssetsNondepreciableAxis which is a typed dimension, to represent other nondepreciable capital assets not represented in the taxonomy. If not used, represents the sum of capital assets nondepreciable.

r760.note: Section 1400 and Paragraph 103. Can be used with NameOfCapitalAssetsDepreciableNetOfAccumulatedDepreciationAndAmortizationAxis which is a typed dimension which can be used to represent a specific type of Capital Assets, Depreciable which is not represented in the taxonomy. If no axis is used, this element represents total Capital Assets, Depreciable, Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization.
